## MultishiftChangeHandlerProps interface

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export interface MultishiftChangeHandlerProps<GItem = any> 
```

## Properties

|  Property | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [onOuterClick](./multishift.multishiftchangehandlerprops.onouterclick.md) | <code>(state: MultishiftState&lt;GItem&gt;) =&gt; void</code> |  |
|  [onStateChange](./multishift.multishiftchangehandlerprops.onstatechange.md) | <code>(changes: MultishiftStateProps&lt;GItem&gt;, state: MultishiftState&lt;GItem&gt;) =&gt; void</code> | This function is called anytime the internal state changes. This can be useful if you're using multishift as a "controlled" component, where you manage some or all of the state (e.g. isOpen, selectedItems, highlightedIndexes, etc) and then pass it as props, rather than letting multishift control all its state itself.<!-- -->The parameters both take the shape of internal state (<!-- -->{<!-- -->highlightedIndex: number, inputValue: string, isOpen: boolean, selectedItem: any<!-- -->}<!-- -->) but differ slightly. |

|  [onSelectedItemsChange(selectedItems, state)](./multishift.multishiftchangehandlerprops.onselecteditemschange.md) | Called when the selected items change, either by the user selecting an item or the user clearing the selection. Called with the items that were selected or an empty array when removed |
